definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in

sentences.english: I clenched my hand with a wrathful spark in my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我握緊雙手，眼裏冒著憤怒的火花。

sentences.english: The lifeguard saved the drowning girl at the risk of (losing) his life.
sentences.chinese: 這個救生員冒著生命的危險救起溺水的女孩。

sentences.english: They braved the storm to rescue us.
sentences.chinese: 他們冒著大風雨來救我們。

sentences.english: So, they take this enormous risk and many of them have died.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他們冒著這麼巨大的風險，而且許多也喪了命。

sentences.english: Mike clench his hand with a wrathful spark in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 麥克握緊雙手，眼裏冒著憤怒的火花。

definition: variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to give thought (to others)/to consider (other people's needs)/also pr. [zhao2 xiang3]
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
to have one's eyes on (a goal)/having sth in mind/to concentrate
